00079 class MESQUITE_EXPORT MappingFunction 
00080 {
00081 public:
00082 
00083   virtual
00084   ~MappingFunction() {}
00085 
00087   virtual 
00088   EntityTopology element_topology() const = 0;
00089   
00097   virtual
00098   int num_nodes() const = 0;
00099   
00107   virtual
00108   NodeSet sample_points( NodeSet higher_order_nodes ) const;
00109 
00126   virtual 
00127   void coefficients( Sample location,
00128                      NodeSet nodeset,
00129                      double* coeff_out,
00130                      size_t* indices_out,
00131                      size_t& num_coeff_out,
00132                      MsqError& err ) const = 0;
00133                      
00134     /*\brief Convert connectivity list indices for different element types.
00135      *
00136      * Given two elements of the same topology but different types
00137      * (number of nodes) and a list of indices into the connectivity
00138      * list for one element type, convert the list to be indices
00139      * into a second element type such that the node in the same logical
00140      * position (e.g. middle of edge 1) is indicated.
00141      */
00142   static inline
00143   void convert_connectivity_indices( EntityTopology topology,
00144                                      int num_nodes_in_input_elem_type,
00145                                      int num_nodes_in_output_elem_type,
00146                                      size_t* index_list,
00147                                      unsigned num_indices,
00148                                      MsqError& err );
00149                                      
00150     /*\brief Convert connectivity list indices for different element types.
00151      *
00152      * Given an element type with the same topology as that of this
00153      * mapping function but with a different number of nodes, convert
00154      * indices into the connectivity list of this element type to
00155      * those of the specified element type such that indices indicate
00156      * nodes at the corresponding logical locations (e.g. middle of edge 1).
00157      */
00158   inline
00159   void convert_connectivity_indices( int num_nodes_in_output_element_type,
00160                                      size_t* index_list, 
00161                                      unsigned num_indices,
00162                                      MsqError& err ) const
00163     { convert_connectivity_indices( element_topology(), num_nodes(),
00164                                     num_nodes_in_output_element_type,
00165                                     index_list, num_indices, err ); }
00166 
00167 private:
00168   static
00169   void convert_connectivity_indices_impl( EntityTopology topology,
00170                                      int num_nodes_in_input_elem_type,
00171                                      int num_nodes_in_output_elem_type,
00172                                      size_t* index_list,
00173                                      unsigned num_indices,
00174                                      MsqError& err );
00175 };

00536 
00537 
00538 inline void
00539 MappingFunction::convert_connectivity_indices( EntityTopology topo,
00540                                                int input_type,
00541                                                int output_type,
00542                                                size_t* index_list,
00543                                                unsigned num_indices,
00544                                                MsqError& err )
00545 {
00546     // If the types are the same or either type has only corner
00547     // vertices, then no conversion is necessary.
00548   const int num_corners = TopologyInfo::corners(topo);
00549   if (input_type != output_type && input_type != num_corners && output_type != num_corners)
00550     convert_connectivity_indices_impl( topo, input_type, output_type, index_list, num_indices, err );
00551 } 
00552   
00553
